info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.voltshare
info.description: F5XC VoltShare service serves APIs for users to securing the secrets to share it with each other.

post.description: DecryptSecret API takes blinded encrypted secret and policy and responds with blinded decrypted secret if user is allowed by the policy

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

post.description:
Request to get voltshare audit logs that matches the criteria in request.
If no match conditions are specified in the request, then the response contains all
CRUD operations performed.

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

get.description:
The response for audit log query contain no more than 500 messages.
One can use scroll request to scroll through more than 500 messages or all messages
in multiple batches. empty scroll_id in the response indicates no more messages to fetch (EOF).

logAggregationRequest.description:
x-displayName: "Aggregation Request"
Aggregation request to provide analytics data over the log response
logAggregationRequest.title: Aggregation Request

logAvgAggregationData.description:
x-displayName: "Avg Aggregation Data"
Average Aggregation data
logAvgAggregationData.title: AvgAggregationData

value.description:
x-displayName: "Value"
x-example: 985.0

value corresponding to the average value of field
value.title: value

logCardinalityAggregationData.description:
x-displayName: "Cardinality Aggregation Data"
Approximate count of distinct values of the log field specified in the request.
logCardinalityAggregationData.title: CardinalityAggregationData

count.description:
x-displayName: "Count"
x-example: 100
Count of distinct values of a log field
count.title: count

logDateAggregation.description:
x-displayName: "Date Aggregation"
Aggregate access logs based on timestamp in the log
logDateAggregation.title: Date Aggregation

step.description:
x-displayName: "Step"
x-required
x-example: "5m"

step is the resolution width, which determines the number of the data points [x-axis (time)] to be returned in the response.
The timestamps in the response will be t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days
step.title: step

sub_aggs.description:
x-displayName: "Sub Aggregation"
This option provides sub-aggregation for each date bucket
sub_aggs.title: sub aggregation

logDateAggregationBucket.description:
x-displayName: "Date Aggregation Bucket"
Date histogram bucket containing the timestamp and the number of logs in that bucket.
logDateAggregationBucket.title: DateAggregationBucket

count.description:
x-displayName: "Count"
x-example: 45

number of logs in this bucket
count.title: count

sub_aggs.description:
x-displayName: "Sub Aggregation"
Sub aggregation data for the date bucket
sub_aggs.title: sub aggregation

logDateAggregationData.description:
x-displayName: "Date Aggregation Data"
Date aggregation data
logDateAggregationData.title: DateAggregationData

buckets.description:
x-displayName: "Buckets"
Lists of buckets containing timestamp and the corresponding log count
buckets.title: buckets

step.description:
x-displayName: "Step"
x-example: "30m"
Actual step size in the response. It could be higher than the requested step depending on the query duration and/or the log rollups.
Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days
step.title: step

metricsVoltShareAccessCounter.description: VoltShareAccessCounter contains the access count for each unique combination of group_by label in the request.
metricsVoltShareAccessCounter.title: VoltShare Access Counter

metricsVoltShareAccessId.description:
VoltShareAccessId uniquely identifies an entry in the response.
VoltShare access count is aggregated based on the MetricLabel specified in the group_by field in the request.
Therefore, only the fields that corresponds to the MetricLabel in the group_by will have non-empty
value in the response.
metricsVoltShareAccessId.title: VoltShareAccessId

country.description:
Country from where the API call was made

Example: ` "US"`
country.title: Country

result.description:
Result of the VoltShare operation

Example: ` "Success"`
result.title: Result

user_tenant.description:
Tenant that made the VoltShare API call

Example: ` "customer1"`
user_tenant.title: User Tenant

metricsVoltShareMetricLabel.description:
VoltShare Access metric can be sliced and diced based
on one or more labels listed below.
metricsVoltShareMetricLabel.title: MetricLabel

metricsVoltShareMetricLabelFilter.description:
VoltShare Access metric is tagged with labels mentioned in MetricLabel.
Metric label filter can be specified to query/aggregate specific timeseries based on label match
metricsVoltShareMetricLabelFilter.title: MetricLabelFilter

value.description:
Value to be compared with

Example: ` "ENCRYPT"`
value.title: Value

metricsVoltShareMetricLabelOp.description: The operator to use when querying VoltShare Access metrics with labels.
metricsVoltShareMetricLabelOp.title: MetricLabelOp

metricsVoltShareMetricValue.description: Value returned for a VoltShare Access Metrics query
metricsVoltShareMetricValue.title: Metric Value

schemaSortOrder.description:
Sort algorithm

Sort in descending order
Sort in ascending order
schemaSortOrder.title: SortOrder

schemaTrendSentiment.description:
x-displayName: "Trend Sentiment"
trend sentiment

 - TREND_SENTIMENT_NONE: x-displayName: "None"
 - TREND_SENTIMENT_POSITIVE: x-displayName: "Positive"
Indicates trend sentiment is positive
 - TREND_SENTIMENT_NEGATIVE: x-displayName: "Negative"
Indicates trend sentiment is negative.
schemaTrendSentiment.title: Trend Sentiment

schemaTrendValue.description:
x-displayName: "Trend Value"
Trend value contains trend value, trend sentiment and trend calculation description and window size.
schemaTrendValue.title: Trend Value

description.description:
x-displayName: "Description"
x-example: "Trend was calculated by comparing the avg of window size intervals of end-start Time and last window time interval"
description of the method used to calculate trend.
description.title: Description

voltshareAuditLogAggregationRequest.description: Request to get only aggregation data for audit logs
voltshareAuditLogAggregationRequest.title: AuditLogAggregationRequest

aggs.description:
Aggregations provide summary/analytics data over the log response. If the number of logs that matched the query
 is large and cannot be returned in a single response message, user can get helpful insights/summary using aggregations.
 The aggregations are keyed by user-defined aggregation name. The response will be keyed with the same name.
 Optional
aggs.title: aggregations

end_time.description:
fetch audit logs whose timestamp <= end_time
 format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "2019-09-24T12:30:11.733Z"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: end time

namespace.description:
fetch aggregation data scoped by namespace

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: namespace

query.description:
query is used to specify the list of matchers
 syntax for query := {[<matcher>]}
 <matcher> := <field_name><operator>"<value>"
 <field_name> := string
  One or more of the following fields in audit log may be specified in the query.
   user - user name
   src_ip - source ip address
   secret_name - secret name
   author_tenant - tenant name of the secret creator
   operation - Encrypt/Decrypt
   result - Success/Fail
   country - Country name
 <value> := string
 <operator> := ["="|"!="|"=~"|"!~"]
   = : equal to
   != : not equal to
 When more than one matcher is specified in the query, then audit logs matching ALL the matchers will be returned in the response.

 Optional: If not specified, all the audit logs matching the given tenant will be considered for aggregation

Example: ` "{user=\"abc@xyz.com\"}"`
query.title: query

start_time.description:
fetch audit logs whose timestamp >= start_time
 format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
           If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

Example: ` "2019-09-23T12:30:11.733Z"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
start_time.title: start time

aggs.description:
Aggregations provide summary/analytics data over the log response. If the number of logs that matched the query
 is large and cannot be returned in a single response message, user can get helpful insights/summary using aggregations.
 The aggregation data is keyed with the aggregation name specified in the request.
aggs.title: aggregations

total_hits.description:
total number of log messages that matched the query.

Example: ` "0"`
total_hits.title: total hits

voltshareAuditLogRequest.description: Request to fetch voltshare audit logs
voltshareAuditLogRequest.title: AuditLogRequest

aggs.description:
Aggregations provide summary/analytics data over the log response. If the number of logs that matched the query
 is large and cannot be returned in a single response message, user can get helpful insights/summary using aggregations.
 The aggregations are keyed by user-defined aggregation name. The response will be keyed with the same name.
 Optional
aggs.title: aggregations

end_time.description:
fetch audit logs whose timestamp <= end_time
 format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "2019-09-24T12:30:11.733Z"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: end time

limit.description:
limits the number of logs returned in the response
 Optional: If not specified, first or last 500 log messages that matches the query (depending on the sort order) will be returned in the response.
           The maximum value for limit is 500.

Example: ` "0"`
limit.title: limit

namespace.description:
fetch the log messages scoped by namespace

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: namespace

query.description:
query is used to specify the list of matchers
 syntax for query := {[<matcher>]}
 <matcher> := <field_name><operator>"<value>"
 <field_name> := string
  One or more of the following fields in audit log may be specified in the query.
   user - user name
   src_ip - source ip address
   secret_name - secret name
   author_tenant - tenant name of the secret creator
   operation - Encrypt/Decrypt
   result - Success/Fail
   country - Country name
 <value> := string
 <operator> := ["="|"!="|"=~"|"!~"]
   = : equal to
   != : not equal to
   =~ : regex match
   !~ : not regex match
 When more than one matcher is specified in the query, then audit logs matching ALL the matchers will be returned in the response.

 Optional: If not specified, all the audit logs matching the given tenant will be returned.

Example: ` "{user=\"abc@xyz.com\"}"`
query.title: query

scroll.description:
Scroll is used to retrieve large number of log messages (or all log messages) that matches the query.
 If scroll is set to true, the scroll_id in the response can be used in the scroll API to fetch the next
 batch of logs until there are no more logs left to return. The number of messages in each batch is determined
 by the limit field.
 Note: Scroll is used for processing large amount of data and therefore is not intended for real time user request.
 Optional: default is false

Example: ` "true"`
scroll.title: scroll

start_time.description:
fetch audit logs whose timestamp >= start_time
 format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
           If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

Example: ` "2019-09-23T12:30:11.733Z"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
start_time.title: start time

aggs.description:
Aggregations provide summary/analytics data over the log response. If the number of logs that matched the query
 is large and cannot be returned in a single response message, user can get helpful insights/summary using aggregations.
 The aggregation data is keyed with the aggregation name specified in the request.
aggs.title: aggregations

logs.description:
list of log messages that matched the query. Not all log messages that matched the query are returned in the response.

Example: ` "value"`
logs.title: logs

scroll_id.description:
Long Base-64 encoded string which can be used to retrieve next batch of log messages using the scroll request.
 Empty scroll_id indicates no more messages to scroll (EOF).
 Note: scroll_id is valid only for 2 minutes. i.e., If one intend to retrieve next batch of the result, then the
       scroll request should be sent within 2 minutes upon receiving the AuditLogResponse.

Example: ` "Vm9sdGVycmEgRWRnZSBQbGF0Zm9ybQ=="`
scroll_id.title: scroll id

total_hits.description:
total number of log messages that matched the query.

Example: ` "0"`
total_hits.title: total hits

voltshareAuditLogScrollRequest.description:
Scroll request is used to fetch large number of log messages in multiple batches with each LogResponse
containing no more than 500 (max value for limit in the request) log messages. To scroll through more than 500 or
all log messages, one can use the LogScrollRequest. Use the scroll_id returned in the LogResponse to fetch the next
batch of log messages and one can continue this process till the scroll_id returned in the LogResponse is "" which
indicates no more log messages to scroll.
voltshareAuditLogScrollRequest.title: AuditLogScrollRequest

namespace.description:
fetch the log messages scoped by namespace

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: namespace

scroll_id.description:
Long Base-64 encoded string which can be used to retrieve next batch of log messages.

Example: ` "Vm9sdGVycmEgRWRnZSBQbGF0Zm9ybQ=="`
scroll_id.title: scroll id

voltshareDecryptSecretRequest.description: DecryptSecretRequest contains parameters for DecryptSecret API
voltshareDecryptSecretRequest.title: DecryptSecret Request

Blinded Encrypted Key in base64 format

Example: ` "value"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
blinded_encrypted_key_base64.title: blinded_encrypted_key

Base64 encoded HMAC of the policy document

Example: ` "value"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
policy_document_hmac_base64.title: policy_document_hmac

voltshareDecryptSecretResponse.description: DecryptSecretResponse contains the response of DecryptSecret API
voltshareDecryptSecretResponse.title: DecryptSecret Response

blinded_key_base64.description:
Blinded Key in base64 format

Example: ` "value"`
blinded_key_base64.title: blinded_key

voltsharePolicyInformationType.description: PolicyInformation contains user defined policy and metadata added by the backend server.
voltsharePolicyInformationType.title: Policy Information

blindfold_key_version.description:
Version of BlindfoldKey that will be used for encryption

Example: ` "0"`
blindfold_key_version.title: blindfold_key_version

creation_time.description: Creation time for this policy document
creation_time.title: creation_time

policy_id.description:
A unique 31 bit number assigned to this policy.

Example: ` "0"`
policy_id.title: policy_id

voltsharePolicyType.description: Policy contains user defined policy. It contains list of allowed users and expiry time
voltsharePolicyType.title: Policy

allowed_users.description:
List of Users allowed to decrypt the secret

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 256
allowed_users.title: allowed_users

expiration_timestamp.description: Until when this policy is valid. After expiration only author can decrypt the secret.
expiration_timestamp.title: expiration_timestamp

secret_name.description:
Name of the secret

Example: ` "value"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_bytes: 1
secret_name.title: secret_name

voltshareProcessPolicyResponse.description: Response of the ProcessPolicyInformation API. It contains Processed Policy, HMAC of the policy and PublicKey to be used for encryption
voltshareProcessPolicyResponse.title: ProcessPolicyResponse

policy_document_hmac_base64.description:
Base64 encoded HMAC of the policy document

Example: ` "value"`
policy_document_hmac_base64.title: policy_document_hmac

public_key.description:
PublicKey Document contains information about PublicKey used to encrypt symmetric encryption key. Private part of this key is ONLY with F5XC Secret Management service.
 Value of this field is a base64 string. When decoded, it unmarshal to PublicKeyDocumentType structure.

Example: ` "value"`
public_key.title: Public Key Document

voltshareUserRecordType.description: UserRecordType contains information about a user
voltshareUserRecordType.title: User Record

email.description:
email id of the user

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.email: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_bytes: 1
email.title: email

tenant.description:
Tenant of the user

Example: ` "value"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_bytes: 1
tenant.title: tenant

voltshareVoltShareAccessCountRequest.description: Request to get number of VoltShare API calls aggregated across multiple dimensions like OPERATION, COUNTRY, RESULT, USER_TENANT
voltshareVoltShareAccessCountRequest.title: VoltShareAccessCountRequest

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570007981"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: End time

group_by.description:
Aggregate data by one or more labels listed here.
 OPERATION, RESULT, USER_TENANT, COUNTRY.

 Optional: If not specified, then the metric is aggregated across all the labels
group_by.title: Group by

label_filter.description:
List of label filter expressions of the form "label" Op "value".
 Response will only contain data that matches all the conditions specified in the label_filter.
 One or more of the following labels can be specified in the label_filter.
 OPERATION, RESULT, USER_TENANT, COUNTRY.

 Optional: If not specified, then the metrics will be filtered only based on the namespace in the request.
label_filter.title: Label Filter

namespace.description:
namespace is used to scope the security events for the given namespace.

Example: ` "blogging-app-namespace-1"`
namespace.title: Namespace

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
           If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

Example: ` "1570007981"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
start_time.title: Start time

step.description:
step is the resolution width, which determines the number of the data points [x-axis (time)] to be returned in the response.
 The timestamps in the response will be t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Optional: If not specified, then step size is evaluated to <end_time - start_time>

Example: ` "15m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_step: true
step.title: Step

voltshareVoltShareAccessCountResponse.description: VoltShare access count for each unique combination of group_by labels in the VoltShareAccessCountRequest.
voltshareVoltShareAccessCountResponse.title: VoltShareAccessCountResponse

data.description: List of VoltShare Access count data for each unique combination of group_by labels
data.title: Security events counter data

step.description:
Actual step size used in the response. It could be higher than the requested step due to metric rollups and the query duration.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

Example: ` "30m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.time_interval: true
step.title: step
